result.execSummary:
The defendant James C Mccoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James C Mccoy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant James C Mccoy in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 164 days in the House of Correction with credit for 164 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.  Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 03-15-2017 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Appeal rights given.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant was not produced.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  All parties are notified that effective March 14, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michael Hanrahan - Branch 4 in Room 622 - Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant James C Mccoy not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  The defendant was not produced from Waukesha County Jail.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT RELEASED WITHOUT BAIL.  Court orders the defendant TURNED OVER TO Waukesha County (active warrant).  Court orderes defendant to be returned to Milwaukee County upon resolution of the Waukesha County case.

Defendant James C Mccoy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant James C Mccoy in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes his plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Additional statements by:  Kevin H.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant James C Mccoy not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant James C Mccoy not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court waives the appearance of the defendant for this hearing only.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on December 16, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant James C Mccoy not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel advised the court that the defendant was ready to change his plea until about 11:30 am today.  The defendant has a hold in Waukesha.  Defense counsel withdraws the demand for speedy trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson in court, defendant James C Mccoy not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on October 21, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.
Denfendant to have NO VIOLENT CONTACT with Kevin H., Keio J., and the address listed on the No Violent Contact Order.

Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered cash bail set at $350.00 with turnover to Justice Point monitoring. Defendant is not be be released from the jail until an address for the defendant with someone other than the victim or the witnesses is verified UNLESS the victim or witness agrees to the defendant living at the residence.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the criminal complaint. Defendant pled not guilty. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant James C Mccoy in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant James C Mccoy in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
BRANCH 25 FOR BRANCH 24. Case set for review hearing. Email correspondence with attachments received and filed. Parties have reviewed the doctor's report. Neither party is challenging the findings of the report. Court accepts the opinions of the doctor and finds the defendant competent to proceed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Review Hearing on Tuesday, October 6, 2015 at 1:30 PM in BR 24, CH Rm 622 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee Court.
Received and Filed, Faxed letter from WCS.
Court appointed attorney Elizabeth A. Carlson at County expense. Order received, signed, and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE REVIEW HEARING IN BRANCH 24
Order for Commitment received, signed, and filed with court.
Court ordered no contact with his father and Keyo.

Defendant James C Mccoy in court with attorney Elizabeth Carlson.  Defendant James C Mccoy in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court appointed attorney Elizabeth Carlson to represent the Defendant. Parties are not contesting the report. Court adopts the findings dated July 24, 2015. Court finds that DHS is authorized to administer medications(s) or treatment to the Defendant and shall observe appropriate medical standards in doing so.  Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James C Mccoy not in court, defendant in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant refused to be interviewed by the Public Defender's office.  The defendant is listed as a "high risk" in the jail.  Court appoints attorney Elizabeth Carlson to represent the defendant at the county's expense.  Attorney Carlson was emailed a copy of the report and advised the clerk that she would try to review the report with the defendant.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James C Mccoy in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant James C Mccoy in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant refuses representation by the Public Defenders Office.    Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
